beerDescription: Extreme drinkability, whose aroma is illuminated by mango, orange, mandarin and grapefruit, will show you a carefully intoxicated path to the bright ale with a symbolic name. The lighthouse is made of selected barley and wheat malts, created after the collision of two large brewing schools - traditional German and innovative American.

The new Dogma darling has arrived! Notes of coffee and chocolate in the aroma, full and milky taste in the mouth. Six special malts and the addition of roasted barley and lactose. Meet Crna Krava, which is a classic island stout, enriched with milky taste!

Albino 'White IPA' is a beer style created somewhere between the Belgian Wit and the well-known India Pale Ale. By combining barley and wheat malt with a carefully determined share of wheat flakes, we have created a beer with a balanced body, pleasant aromas and bitterness obtained by using American hops - Chinook, Simcoe and Cascade. We added a little orange peel to all that and got a refreshing, summer White IPA.

Produced using the traditional double fermentation process, a Dunkel which Michael Jackson, the Beer Hunter, described as "impenetrably dark with a golden-brown gleam; with a warm aroma and malty taste, while summoning up coffee taste sensations on going down."

Our Ayinger Ur-Weisse is an old-fashioned wheat with some fine roasted malt to give it more color and flavor than golden hefeweizen. It has an immense crown of lovely foam held proudly above a robe of translucent amber. On the palate, malt and yeast predominate, with a delicious balance of fruit and bread-like yeast.

With its drinkability, softness and aromas of tropical fruits, white wine, passion fruit and papaya on the hop side (Idaho 7 & Nelson Sauvin), as well as light malt and rice on the malt side, CALCULATOR will bring you closer to the complex process of calculating and finding the perfect combination of ingredients every time you create new beer recipes!

120 Minute IPA is brewed to a colossal 45-degree plato, boiled for a full two hours while being continuously hopped with high-alpha American hops, then dry-hopped daily in the fermenter for a month and aged for another month on whole-leaf hops!

A beer that will ignite all your senses! Using the dry hop technique, we have created a drinkable and strong combination of tropical and floral aromas, for all fans of authentic India Pale Ale style. The American School of Brewing and passion for beer made this hop monster leave a striking impression after each sip.

Erdinger Weissbier is a classic German wheat beer, or Weissbier with an impressive array of aromas and flavours. Brewed by Erdinger in the heart of Bavaria, this Weissbier shows off a pale blonde body capped by an abundant creamy white head.

Erdinger Weissbier Dunkel is a rich and smooth wheat beer specialty from Erdinger Weissbräu. It owes its full-bodied flavor to the fine hops and dark malt used in its production. The dark beer specialty is brewed according to an age-old recipe.
Big toasty malt flavors with balanced hop bitterness and spicy rye offer a full and complex texture with a refined bittered finish. A truly different IPA for dark beer fans.

Bloodline defies genre: Hops for the hop-heads. Fruit for the rest. Sweet blood orange puree is added toward the end of fermentation to balance the citrusy sharpness of the hops and deliver a hard-charging ABV to keep the good times rolling.

The standard in pale ales, this beautiful amber liquid perfectly balances 4 different types of hops, then melds them together with Carastan malts to create an incredibly satisfying beer-flavored beer that tastes like beer.

Today, Hofbräu Dunkel - the archetypal Bavarian beer - is still as popular as ever. With its alcoholic content of around 5.5% volume and its spicy taste, it's a refreshing beer that suits all kinds of occasion. A beer in the traditional Munich style!
A liter of Hofbräu Original! Luminous golden yellow with foamy white crown – you can already taste the refreshment: Slightly malty, full-bodied, mature and with an elegant finish.

Oskar Blues DevianT Dale’s IPA – Pours a golden orange color with a couple fingers of white head and plenty of lacing. Smells of sugary sweetness and citrusy hops, with a little pine and resin poking through as well. Taste is very sweet with tons of that citrus and pine hop flavor and just enough bitterness in the finish to balance out the sweet start. Mouthfeel is really nice, smooth, almost creamy, light but well balanced carbonation.
Then wheat, malt, and sparkling roast aroma. Weissbier Dunkel is a muscular beer. Unfiltered, strong, and nutty. At the same time, smooth and soft to the taste.

A true classic of quintessential Munich and Bavarian drinks. Clear and sparkling bright golden in the glass, crowned by a pure white head, it is usually drunk in the shade of a chestnut tree according to tradition.
A beer which always goes down well: mild, elegant malts with a hint of sweetness and a soft hint of hops in the background. This is pure Bavarian life style!

In the mouth, it is lightly pilsner bitter, with notes of malt. Nice beer. Pours a semi opaque deep yellow with a decent foamy head, nice carbonation and some visible sediment. Smell some grains ,slight Diacetyl (buttery) cracker,malt.

Deep, dark and fragrant, it combines a colossal mash bill with four of our favourite international hop varietals. Once poured, aromas of cut grass, musk lolly and coffee waft from the pint. The bitterness is on the low side, giving rise to an extravagant palate of espresso, pine and mint slice.
Lots of wheat and oats and touch of lactose for creamy body and there you go - crazy wheat beer! Silky and smooth, it really feels like a beach cake punch.

Sierra Nevada Pale Ale is a delightful example of the classic pale ale style. It has a deep amber color and a exceptionally full-bodied, complex character. The fragrant bouquet and spicy flavor are the results of the generous use of the best Cascade hops.

Summer Solstice is a slightly sweet, malty session beer with a creamy mouth feel and clean finish. With hints of caramel in the nose and a touch of spice, it's become affectionately known as “summer in a can”. The unique flavors and superior drinkability make for the ultimate refreshment on a hot summer day.
SweetWater 420 Extra Pale Ale is a tasty West Coast Style Pale Ale with a stimulating hops character and a crisp finish. Brewed with Munich, 40L, and 2-Row malts and Centennial and Cascade hops.

SweetWater endowed this straight up juice bomb with a double dry hop of Mosaic, Citra, El Dorado and Azacca for a blast of mango, stone fruit, lime and pine. It's not a mirage, but a tasty refreshing oasis in your pursuit of haziness.

A crisp yet distinct Pilsner brewed with German hops that bring vivid notes of floral and spice with citrus and lemon. This is truly brilliant, bringing nuanced complexity together with smooth, easy drinking.

Weihenstephaner's Hefe Weiss is an impressive Weissbier brewed by the world's oldest operational brewery. This unfiltered Wheat beer pours cloudy pale with a bouquet full of fruity, fresh scents accompanied by intense wheat and spice notes, including coriander, clove and nutmeg.

The goal was simple: brew a beer that's smooth like a lager and crisp like an ale. That's how Genesee created a true American original in Cream Ale. This award-winning beer has been the style standard since it was first brewed in 1960 and remains just as smooth and flavorful as it's always been. Year-round Favorite!
A deliciously refreshing golden ale, at 4.8% ABV, brewed with the finest malts and hops giving a sweet crisp citrus finish with just a hint of honey.
